description: The Trumpet Creeper (Campsis radicans 'Indian Summer') is an amazing species for its dramatic, vibrant performance. Bright orange-red trumpet shaped flowers bloom near the end of summer and stand out against its stunning dark green foliage. This fast-growing, adaptable vine clings easily to trees, walls, or fences and can reach heights of 30 feet within just a few years. The orange-bronze leaves of 'Indian Summer' keep their colour from summer to fall, adding a unique burst of colour to the autumn landscape. It is an excellent choice for bringing colour to trellises, arches, and other garden structures.
